sentence_a: Right next to you, someone fires a handgun.
sentence_b: Someone fires a handgun in the distance.

sentence_a: You hear the baby crying in the crib right in front of you.
sentence_b: In the day-care centre down the hall, you hear a baby crying.

sentence_a: In the kitchen, you're using the blender to make a smoothie.
sentence_b: You're woken up by your mum downstairs using the blender.

sentence_a: As you are petting the cat, it meows.
sentence_b: A cat somewhere in your neighbor's yard meows.

sentence_a: You hold the champagne bottle in your hand and pop it open.
sentence_b: At the opposite end of the restaurant, someone pops a champagne bottle up.

sentence_a: While you're touring the bell tower, the church bells start to ring.
sentence_b: In the neighboring town, the church bells are ringing.

sentence_a: While you're milking the cow, it starts mooing.
sentence_b: Across the field, the cow starts mooing.

sentence_a: You are standing right in the middle of the applauding audience.
sentence_b: From outside, you know the concert is over because the audience is applauding.

sentence_a: The cuckoo-clock right above you strikes midnight.
sentence_b: From the far end of the garden, you hear the cuckoo-clock strike 12.

sentence_a: You step into the chicken coop and a rooster crows.
sentence_b: Early in the morning, the rooster down the hill crows.

sentence_a: Right next to you, the dog is barking.
sentence_b: In your neighbor's yard, a dog is barking.

sentence_a: You are drilling a screw into the wall with the power drill.
sentence_b: The construction worker across the street is using a power drill.

sentence_a: You are using a hammer to pound a nail into the wall.
sentence_b: A construction worker down the hall pounds a nail into the wall.

sentence_a: The Harley Davidson right in front of you is rumbling.
sentence_b: Blocks away, a Harley Davidson is rumbling.

sentence_a: While you're horseback-riding, your horse neighs.
sentence_b: At the other end of the field, a horse neighs.

sentence_a: You are standing next to a construction worker using a jackhammer.
sentence_b: Somewhere far away from you, a construction worker is using a jackhammer.

sentence_a: As you walk up to the door, someone knocks on it.
sentence_b: You're sitting upstairs when someone knocks at the front door.

sentence_a: Right next to you, a machine gun is firing.
sentence_b: In the distance, a machine gun is firing.

sentence_a: The sheep walks up to you and bleats.
sentence_b: The sheep wanders to the other side of the hill from you and bleats.

sentence_a: As you hold the frog in your hands, it starts to croak.
sentence_b: At the other end of the pond, a frog starts to croak.

sentence_a: You stand in front of the toilet and flush it.
sentence_b: Someone upstairs flushes the toilet.

sentence_a: You stand next to the waterfall as the water cascades down.
sentence_b: You stand across the valley from the waterfall, as the water cascades down.

sentence_a: You quickly open the can of soda.
sentence_b: Across the bar, a man quickly opens a can of soda.

sentence_a: As you walk through the forest, branches crack under your feet.
sentence_b: Somewhere off in the forest, branches are cracking under someone's feet.
